Comments.Message: running firefox 3.6.3 and silverlight 3.0.50106.0 on windows vista
You did approve Rawr to use isolated storage when asked right?
There was never such a question....just a crash.

I'm not sure exactly why that would crash, but here are some possible reasons:

The group quota for the store is set to zero.

-or-

The store has been removed but cannot be recreated because a directory or file is being used by another process. 

-or-

Isolated storage is disabled.

I would suggest you check your silverlight settings. Right click on the area where Rawr is and select Silverlight. Go to last tab called Application Storage. Make sure Enable application storage is checked and that elitistjerks.com quota is not 0.

I could not even check the silverlight settings.  Researching the problem, I found this

http://pietschsoft.com/post/2008/09/Silverlight-Isolated-Storage-File-Directory-Location.aspx

I found that the folder used by silverlight, "is" did not exist and the folder "silverlight" was read only.  Changing permissions, I was able to get silverlight to run....eventually I was able to change the quota for elitistjerks.com and get things to work.
